data.title: STAY FAR FAR AWAY
data.text:
I unfortunately stumbled upon this place because another hotel had last night reservation.  Looking on the website the rate was $57.  The owner of the hotel quoted me a higher rate at the front desk.  Once I explain the online rate she offered me only a $60 rate.  Arrived in room and it was very old 1960s or 70s look.  Went to get on the Internet to do all of my paperwork,  and from the desk in room I kept losing Internet connection.  I literally had to stand out in the parking lot to get any Internet.  Then I went to clean up and noticed some man's whiskers all over the back of the sink behind the faucet.  In the bathroom there was a dead bug on the floor.  And once I turned my lamp on over the desk it was so covered with dust that it was even hanging from it.  Too late to check out I went to dinner.  Came back to turn on the TV and the remote did not work. 
 Had to turn the TV on at the TV point was able to change channels but not adjust the volume.  So laying in bed trying to relax was very difficult due to having to get up and change the volume constantly depending on the channel.  Call the front desk owner came down tried new remote that did not work.  Said she would try a new remote.  I waited 25 minutes for her return,  that's never happened called back to the front desk.  She said that she would only come back if she could find one.  And was not able to.  Did not sleep well because I couldn't wait to check out.  When I did check out in the morning I showed the pictures to her husband the other owner.  And he had nothing to say except I will have to bring that up to housekeeping.  No apologies no discounted rate no nothing.  I am now 1/2 mile away spending the same amount of money in a suites Hotel which offers pool hot tub sauna free hot breakfast  and the staff is amazing.  How this hotel stays in business I have no clue.  It feels  like the type of hotel you should rent by the hour !!!!!!!  If you're thinking of getting a discount on a hotel at a cheaper rate you can find many others in the Boise area.

data.title: One night stand
data.text:
If not for the low cost, this place wouldn't be a good choice. And, the proprietors were very kind and friendly. The rooms have walls made of concrete block. Painting was VERY sloppy, with paint slopped all over counters and towel racks, etc. the TV remote didn't work; the proprietor was unable to resolve. 
Otherwise it was clean. Bed wasn't the best but..., acceptable.

data.title: Good location
data.text: The entry into the motel is a little tricky due to the road layout, but once navigated, the rooms are clean and comfortable. There's no pool or breakfast, but you can walk into the centre of town in 15 minutes. The owner is very helpful but the Internet can be a bit hit and miss.

data.title: Pretty good for the price
data.text: A great location. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The AC was kinda loud but they provide ear plugs in the office (no joke!).  We stayed there for a concert at Outlaw Field. Its close to downtown - just at the west end.  You could walk if you wanted the exercise.

data.title: Staycation!
data.text: We came to Boise to get away for the evening. It was clean, the woman at the front was nice, helpful and welcoming. It's within walking distance of downtown and and all around a great value for the price!

data.title: Work trip
data.text: Was in town to with a 4 man crew to do some specialized repair work at several Boise area restaurants.  There was some event in town that filled almost every hotel room.  Found this place with three available rooms.  The owners were very friendly and accommodating.  My guys thought it was a nice, comfortable place.  If you want fancy this is not the place for you.  But if you want a clean, comfortable place to sleep this will fit the bill.  If we come back in the future we will stay here

data.title: Great hotel for the price
data.text: We stayed here on our way through town and had a great time. The lady who checked us in was friendly and efficient. For the price you won't find a better hotel in a downtown area. It was an older hotel but the furniture looked like it had been upgraded recently, there was no cigarette smell and I was pleasantly surprised to find a refrigerator and a microwave in the room. Most importantly they had HBO and we were there on a Sunday night!

data.title: Gross! Old motel in downtown area. Needs serious updating.
data.text: Reviews and pics deceiving. Bad smell in front office and room smelled something love me Grandmas basement. $85 a night still too much for this wreck. Coffee pot not cleaned out. This seems likely key it has been in Boise a long time and could be a cute retro motel if given a lot of love and talc.

data.title: visit family
data.text: The service was very good-The rooms were clean and it was the biggest bed we have ever seen. It was wonderful could have had 4 in there  Thank you Do not let the age of the building stop you for a great stay

data.title: Clean, Comfortable, Cheap, Great Location for the Price
data.text: If you want an inexpensive night's stay within walking distance of downtown Boise without the downtown price, this is a great place to consider.  It ain't much to look at, but it was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the management was friendly and accommodating.  What more can you ask for a price that is one third the cost of a downtown hotel.  We were able to walk to downtown restaurants in less than 15 minutes.  Saturday we enjoyed the weekly farmer's market near the capitol.  You can rent bicycles at city hall and pedal the bike-friendly streets, stopping to shop or enjoy a bite to eat.  The room had a nice fridge and microwave.  Albertson's grocery store was just 2 blocks north of the motel.  The neighborhood felt safe.  So for the price, we were happy to forego the beauty and amenities of a upscale hotel and enjoy a clean room and comfortable bed for the night.

data.title: Not so good
data.text: The room itself is a nice size and close to downtown. However it does have a smell to it like Indian food. The front desk staff does not provide an area map but it has a desktop computer. You do your own tourist info. I am not a hotel snob and it takes a lot for me to not like a place. Unfortunately this place has made that distinction. Boise is a nice place and if I return I will stay somewhere else.

data.title: Spacious rooms
data.text:
We enjoyed staying here.  Spacious rooms, comfortable beds.
Friendly staff.  Fast internet.
No breakfast provided but there is a microwave and a fridge so you can make your own.
Plenty of room for bags, 2 desks in the room.
Nice cafe nearby.

data.title: Worst motel ever
data.text: This is quite literally the worst place I have ever stayed. The pictures on their website are misleading. Our room was dirty. The coffee pot still had the last guest's coffee in it. The shower did not drain. The room smelled overwhelmingly of cigarette smoke. Our key card only worked half of the time and the door stuck to where the key didn't work well when it was working. The overhead light did not work. The first water from the tap was brown. The smoke alarm was also non-functioning. Our "queen" size beds were actually full size beds. The Cabana Inn is advertised as the best deal in Boise. You would be better off staying anywhere but there. I was thoroughly disgusted. I have stayed in shady off the strip places in Vegas that were better than this. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

data.title: Love the Cabana
data.text: I stay at the Cabana Inn quite a bit.  It is always spotless,  free reliable wifi,  quite, comfy beds and pillows, check in is easy.  Great location,  walking distance to everything downtown.  Rajah in the front office is awesome. See ya soon!  Aimee

data.title: bug bites
data.text: Stayed beginning of October for 2 nights.  Very unfriendly reception, tiles missing in bathroom and smelled musty.  Dirty glass shelf and sink wouldn't drain properly.  Blankets torn and stained.  Wifi did not work unless in one spot in room and then very weak and cut out frequently.  Worst problem ended up with about 20 bug bites each from the 2 night stay.  Had to ask for coffee and other minor things after cleaning? of room.

data.title: Very affordable
data.text: I was looking for the cheapest motel in Boise for my trip and this was it. It was $59.95 for a bare bones room. It had a big bed, fridge, microwave, wifi and non-HD TV. If you are a phobic about cleanliness then keep looking and expect to pay more. If you just need a place to rest, shower, and are into walking the city try them. There are places close for drinkable coffee, breakfast, and entertainment. Some people look for the lowest price and then complain when the place is not 4 star, so just want you to know--I'm cheap.

data.title: A Pleasant Night's Rest
data.text:
I chose the Cabana Inn because I was budget minded.  If you are traveling across the country, all sorts of "doo-dads" and accoutrements are a waste of money, in my opinion.  I want a comfy bed, a good shower, and outlets for recharging by toys (cell phone, digital camera, laptop, etc.).  It may be an older hotel/motel, but it accomplished my goals pleasantly.  I had a good night's sleep, got cleaned up, got my toys recharged, and was off for Oregon the next morning.  

As good as it all was, it must be noted that construction in downtown Boise and one-way streets made finding the Cabana Inn a bit challenging.  Also, the extra mileage to leave I-84 and drive into downtown Boise was a detraction.  Finally, there was no continental breakfast.  (But with the money I saved, a cheap & quick "fast food" breakfast kept the night economical.)

The folks at the front desk were friendly, too, so my overall experience was fine and comfortable.

data.title: Seen better days
data.text: This property is honestly a bit run-down and rough around the edges. It is quite close to downtown, which is a big plus, and also quite affordable, another big plus. It's a bit of a distance to any restaurants. If you don't mind the rough digs, it's a good value for your dollar.

data.title: Oldie but Goodie
data.text: We stopped in Boise on our way to Portland and stumbled across the Inn. It is right downtown and within walking distance of restaurants and other attractions. The bed was great, pillowtop firm and the room was large and quiet and not expensive. We will be there again!

data.title: Cheap room in the City
data.text: I did the Boise 70.3 Half Ironman and stayed here to save some money.  Absolutely not luxury of any kind but it does not hold itself out as such.  Decent value for the cost given the city location.  The room was clean and provided a good place to stay.  I would look elsewhere next time though.
